dashboard.generator

Class Generator

  • java.lang.Object
    • dashboard.generator.Generator
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AddressGenerator

    public abstract class Generator
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides the base functionality for a data generator that creates data and transmits it at regular intervals to a Readout. This can be used to animate Readouts for a cosmetic effect.
    Author:
    Mark Sabini

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Generator()
      Creates a Generator with the default timing interval.
      Generator(int interval)
      Creates a Generator with the timing interval specified by the user.

      Sets whether the Generator is active, i.e.
      void setInterval(int interval)

        public Generator()
        Creates a Generator with the default timing interval.

      • Generator

        public Generator(int interval)
        Creates a Generator with the timing interval specified by the user.
        Parameters:
        interval - the time interval between updates, measured in milliseconds

    • Method Detail

      • setActive

        public void setActive(boolean flag)
        Sets whether the Generator is active, i.e. transmitting data to its Readouts.
        Parameters:
        flag - whether the Generator should be active

      • setInterval

        public void setInterval(int interval)
        Sets the time interval used by the Generator.
        Parameters:
        interval - the time interval between updates, measured in milliseconds
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the interval is negative

      • generate

        public abstract void generate()
        Updates each Readout once with data of a certain form, dependent on the specific subclass.
